data.title: Mean ASCII
data.solution:
import sys
import math

n = int(input())
lowestAVG = 200
highestAVG = 0

for i in range(n):
    s = input()
    tempSum = 0
    tempLen = 0
    for c in s:
        if c.isalpha():
            tempSum += ord(c)
            tempLen += 1
            
    tempAVG = (tempSum / tempLen)
    if tempAVG > highestAVG:
        highestAVG = tempAVG
        lastCharacter = s[-1]
    if tempAVG < lowestAVG:
        lowestAVG = tempAVG
        firstCharacter = s[0]

print(firstCharacter, lastCharacter, sep="")
data.statement:
You are given [[N]] strings.
Calculate the average of the <<alphabetical>> characters' ASCII code in those strings, then output the first character of the string with the lowest, and last character of the string with the highest average.

In case of same averages, always use the string that appeared first.
There will always be at least one alphabetic character in every string.

testCases.title: Space is not alphabetical
testCases.testIn:
4
THIS IS WEIRD
THERE ARE SPACES IN THE TEXT
AND UPPERCASE CHARACTERS
wHaT sHoUld i Do

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
4
I DONT KNOW
DONT PANIC
C O D I N G A M E
AnD lowercase CharAcTeRs in the LAST strinG

testCases.title: Repeating myself
testCases.testIn:
7
abc
cba
CBA
ABC
XYZ
xyz
ZZZ

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testIn:
7
xzx
zxx
xzz
ZXZ
XZZ
ZZX
XZZ

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of strings

data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> First character of the string with the lowest average, and the last character of the string with the highest.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given N strings.
Calculate the average of the alphabetical characters' ASCII code in those strings, then output the first character of the string with the lowest, and last character of the string with the highest average.

In case of same averages, always use the string that appeared first.
There will always be at least one alphabetic character in every string.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of strings
Next N lines: A string s
Output
Line 1: First character of the string with the lowest average, and the last character of the string with the highest.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 10
2 ≤ s lengths ≤ 64
Example
Input
2
Oaaa
zzzK
Output
OK
